title: You know what, I'm tired of the fucking bullshit matching system.
body:
There was a Rioter in a thread talking about League's matching being among the best, and I nearly laughed out loud.

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2585692229/228953398?tab=overview

Tell me this game was fairly matched. I camped the EVERLIVING FUCK out of every lane, did everything I could to try and get my laners back into the game, tried bossing them around to get them to play intelligently... nothing. They just did not understand how in the world the game works or how to not get stunned by Veigar and ulted by MF, or how to let the, you know, tank, be the frontline.

But, you know, that was obviously my fault. Yeah.

So can we stop pretending the matching system is any good? Don't match people by their fucking cosmetic rank, use that MMR system you have. I don't care if I play with diamonds or bronzelords, as long as they play competently and don't go and feed their asses off and make me lose despite doing fine or even great myself.

Oh and before you say to let my laners get the kills... I tried to. I only took kills if I was alone, or if my teammate died (or to prevent them from dying).

This person comes on the boards daily with a new type of complaint about anything and everything, better to just ignore the person

If the playerbase just meekly goes along with whatever the developer does, then greed runs rampant. 

Kind of like how when Beck was talking about starting Riot, he said he was just a gamer that was unhappy with how things were being run. He would regularly complain on the boards and blogs and whatnot like I do -- he tried to get other people to come around and realize that things weren't so great. So, he eventually went and founded a company to make a game, with the driving goal being that he wanted to make a game for gamers, by gamers. 

Too bad that idea died off a while ago.
